alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 26 at 12:15PM PDT until August 28 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Elevated surf of 3 to 6 feet with local sets to 7 feet along with high risk of dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas and Orange County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...From Saturday morning through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Elevated surf and strong rip and longshore currents will create dangerous swimming conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest surf will be along the more southerly facing beaches in Orange County and in San Diego County north of Carlsbad.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas
